res_0: The first Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded in 1901 to Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen, a German physicist, for his discovery of X-rays. Röntgen was awarded 150,782 Swedish kronor (SEK) for his groundbreaking work on the discovery of X-rays, which had a significant impact on the field of medicine and paved the way for diagnostic imaging techniques such as X-ray imaging and radiography.
